intro: Villarsia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed villarsia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, hairy seeds when mature. Villarsia rotundifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
